alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Vicinity, Northern San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 5:07PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Custer and east central Saguache Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 506 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Hayden Pass Burn Scar. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall may cause quick rises of creeks and streams. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Custer and east central Saguache Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Del Norte Vicinity, Northern San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft
